alert.note: Alert for Lower Yukon Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 27 at 11:38AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM AKDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding of low lying areas. * WHERE...Innoko River at Shageluk. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM AKDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding continues along the Innoko River at Shageluk. Residents report water over some roads near the river, including the road to the airport which is impassable. Residents are still accessing the airport by boat. Water levels are gradually receding in Shageluk since cresting last Tuesday but will likely remain above flood stage into Monday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1130 AM AKDT, A surge of water originating from the Yukon River continues to move down the Innoko River and result in extensive overbank flow and flooding. This surge of water will gradually move downriver into early next week with water levels falling vey slowly.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads.
